title: Sales Engineer - REMOTE (North America)
description:
Who are we?

At Lenses.io we are on a mission to democratize streaming data, helping businesses to operate in real-time.

Our technology allows organizations to practice DataOps, anew way of consuming, processing and moving data. Our product makes working with cutting-edge open-source technologies more accessible to users and operationalizes them for enterprises. Our customers, who range from household names like Daimler-Benz and Adidas to cloud-native startups, use Lenses to help run their strategic streaming and software applications: think IoT, fraud-detection AI engines and cutting-edge consumer-facing microservices.

Looking to make a difference?

Are you someone that gets excited about building things? Keen to see your ideas and knowledge shine as they directly impact our product? This is your moment to join a high-growth tech startup on the first floor.

Having established a sales team in the US in 2020, we are now building out our Sales Engineering for the next growth phase. As a Sales Engineer, you will be our technical champion in both pre- and post-sales phases. Using your close customer relationships and deep know-how of the value Lenses brings, you will connect the feedback loop to help drive the Lenses product roadmap.

We are proud of our engineering culture at Lenses.io. During a steep growth period, we have a consistent and opinionated set of best practices that are helping us to scale newly minted technologies like Apache Kafka into enterprise-ready software. Are you ready to work with Kafka, Kubernetes, Streaming SQL, and other modern technologies on-prem and across clouds?

If the answer is ‘yes’ – and you are curious, open-minded, hungry, and eager to learn then Lenses.io is the place for you!


Here is what you will do day-to-day

  • Lead technical engagements where we prove the potential of Lenses through discovery, demos, and POCs
  • Become a trusted advisor for our customers offering best-practices, recommendations, and tips
  • Be a key player in scaling our US business, working closely with sales, marketing, & engineering teams
  • Engage with our customer base and in our vibrant community
  • Be one of our evangelists in the US for Lenses.io and DataOps with customers, and through engaging with content
requirements:
What you will bring

  • Selling into engineering or operations teams in large organizations with a go-getter attitude
  • Ability to present strong technical arguments and best practices bringing inspiration to customers
  • Good knowledge of streaming or messaging systems such as Apache Kafka, Rabbit MQ, JMS, as well as Linux operating systems and first principles
  • Aptitude in system administration and cloud services and some experience working in data analytics
  • Strong emotional intelligence helping product/tech teams to navigate a customer's challenges
  • Business acumen, strong critical thinking, and root-cause analysis as well as strong written and oral skills
  • Working with integrity, proactively follow new trends and technologies in the data analytics and engineering markets
  • Experience in building, running, or architecting distributed technologies and/or selling DevOps tooling is a bonus

title: Business Development Representative - REMOTE (North America)
description:
Who are we?

At Lenses.io we are on a mission to democratize streaming data, helping businesses to operate in real-time.

Our technology allows organizations to practice DataOps, a new way of consuming, processing and moving data. Our product makes working with cutting-edge open-source technologies more accessible to users and operationalizes them for enterprises. Our customers, who range from household names like Daimler-Benz and Adidas to cloud-native startups, use Lenses to help run their strategic streaming and software applications: think IoT, fraud-detection AI engines and cutting-edge consumer-facing microservices.


Looking to make a difference?

Are you someone that gets excited about building things? Keen to see your ideas and knowledge shine as they directly impact our product? This is your moment to join a high-growth tech startup on the ground floor.

We are looking for our first North American Business Development Representative (BDR) to partner with the Field Sales & Marketing teams to convert North American prospects. The BDR leverages outbound prospecting, lead generation, and follow up to help build our fast-growing American customer-base. This is an amazing opportunity for an experienced BDR to take on a new market with tons of greenspace & opportunity.

If you are curious, open-minded, hungry, and eager to learn then Lenses.io is the place for you!


What your day-to-day looks like:
  • Research accounts and prospects to develop compelling and tailored value propositions
  • Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop target accounts from lead-generation activities, such as outbound cold-calling, emailing, and direct mailers into targeted accounts
  • Engage with prospects via phone, email and social selling tools to share the DataOps vision, identify opportunities, and generate interest
  • Handle prospect’s questions & objections, before educating them on Lenses.io and DataOps
  • Distribute qualified new opportunities to appropriate sales representative, collaborating with reps about the opportunity and determining appropriate action items
  • Collaborate with Account Executives to optimize Outbound efforts
  • Work closely with marketing to capitalize on warm engagement from demand generation and content marketing initiatives
  • Maintain notes and activity tracking of accounts and engagement in SFDC
  • Hit your personal target of Deals Generated (quota)
  • Develop in-depth knowledge about the real-time data space
  • Build the foundations of the US sales development, including communications & procedure
requirements:
What you will bring

  • Hands on experience as a SDR/BDR and ability to work in fast paced, constantly evolving environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills including high-level interactions with internal and external contacts
  • Exceptional ability to organize work and tasks; attention to detail and excellent follow-through
  • A strong curiosity to understand the unique challenger that companies in different industries face
  • Passion for learning new things and continuous improvement
  • Desire to build a career in Sales

title: Principal Cloud Architect (Europe - REMOTE)
description:
Who are we?

At Lenses.io we are on a mission to democratize streaming data, helping businesses to operate in real-time.

Our technology allows organizations to practice DataOps, a new way of consuming, processing and moving data. Our product makes working with cutting-edge open-source technologies more accessible to users and operationalizes them for enterprises.

Our customers, who range from household names like Daimler-Benz and Adidas to cloud-native startups, use Lenses to help run their strategic streaming and software applications: think IoT, fraud-detection AI engines and cutting-edge consumer-facing microservices.

Looking to make a difference?

Are you someone that gets excited about building things? Keen to see your ideas and knowledge shine as they directly impact our product? This is your moment to join a high-growth tech startup on the ground floor.

We are looking for a Principal Cloud Architect to play a critical part of our growing company, leading the design and launch of a cloud-hosted service solution. You will bring your expertise to plan, design, document, and maintain the technologies and infrastructure needed to build a scalable and secure cloud offering. You have a great understanding of best practices in automating operations, infrastructure security, high-availability systems, and software development. You'll have the chance to work in an open and collaborative environment to improve our existing technology stack, and infrastructure along the way.

If you are curious, open-minded, hungry, and eager to learn we would love to hear from you!
requirements:
What your day-to-day looks like:

  • Provide in-depth knowledge and strategy regarding cloud capabilities using any of the following Cloud technology services such as AWS or Azure ensuring regulations, security, risk and compliance
  • Work with Agile and DevOps techniques and implementation approaches in the delivery
  • Provide technical leadership to the team and colleagues. Defining and driving the Cloud vision and architecture incl. platform roadmap, service roadmap, and technology selection
  • Create Solutions in terms of delivery organization competencies, processes, tools, dimensioning, costing
  • Lead and be responsible for the cloud architecture on all aspects both functional and non-functional around design of a cloud-based production environment
  • Support Solution for Proof-of-Concept (POCs), 1st and 2nd engagements and develop the value and selling propositions
  • Provide in-depth knowledge and strategy regarding managing kubernetes components, scalability and cost/consumption monitoring
  • Provide advisory and thought leadership on the provision of analytics environments leveraging Cloud based platforms, big data technologies, including integration with existing data and analytics platforms and tools
  • Lead a team of engineers and provide support and development through effective coaching and mentoring
  • Provide support and technical governance, expertise related to cloud architectures, deployment, and operations
  • Develop solutions architecture and evaluate architectural alternatives for private, public and hybrid cloud models, including SaaS, and other cloud services
  • Develop future service offerings and value propositions to keep relevant to the market, including leading virtual teams to create collateral and best practice in partnership with vendor partners

What you will bring

  • Hands-on experience with related/complementary open-source software language GO
  • Significant experience of architecting and implementing cloud solutions
  • Excellent knowledge of cloud architecture design (e.g., AWS Well-Architected)
  • Experience building scalable, resilient, and secured applications
  • Experience with CI/CD & Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform, gitops, chatops)
  • Possess strong knowledge of the Private/Public Cloud offerings from AWS, CGP or Azure
  • Solid Experience with migrations to Public Cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP)
  • Strong hands-on cloud technologies understanding including Kubernetes, Security, non-functional elements, DBs, cloud technologies and services and the ‘as a service’ tools, open source and cloud ecosystem in general, integration methodologies and implementation
  • Demonstrate knowledge of cloud architecture and implementation features (OS, multi-tenancy, virtualization, orchestration, elastic scalability)
  • Demonstrate knowledge of DevOps tool chains and processes
  • Experience in workload management, scalability and distributed platform architectures.
